variant.question: In flight, a pilot cancels his IFR flight plan in order to proceed under VFR in VMC to his destination. The ATC will answer:

options.text: “(time) ... IFR FLIGHT CANCELLED, VFR FLIGHT PLAN OPENED AT ... (time)”
“IFR FLIGHT CANCELLED AT ... (time) VFR FLIGHT PLAN COMMENCES NOW”

variant.question: According to SERA (Standardised European Rules of the Air), when an IFR pilot wants to change from IFR to VFR, he/she must…

options.text: Notify ATC. However, if the weather conditions are IMC during the flight, the flight must remain under IFR.
Request an ATC approval. A change from IFR to VFR does NOT depend on weather conditions.
Notify ATC. However, if the weather conditions are VMC during the flight, the flight must remain under IFR.
Request an ATC approval. The flight should then be performed above 3 000ft AMSL.

variant.question: General provisions – change from IFR to VFR – A change from IFR to VFR is only acceptable when VFR is permitted in that airspace and when?

options.text: the change is initiated by the PIC with a message containing the specific expression “cancel IFR flight”.
the position of the change has been noted on the ATC flight plan. The cancellation of the flight under IFR will then be made automatically by ATC.
the PIC has requested and obtained an ATC clearance for the change and has filed an ATS flight plan for a special VFR flight.
ATC invites the PIC to change from IFR to VFR.

variant.question: During an IFR flight, a pilot wants to change to using Visual Flight Rules (VFR). Which of the following transmissions should the pilot make to initiate this change?

options.text: "I would like to change to VFR"
